newsitem.title: FRANCE: Sri Lanka may seek 100,000 T wheat soon -trade.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka may seek 100,000 T wheat soon -trade.

text.p: Sri Lanka is expected to soon tap world markets again for wheat, European grain traders said on Wednesday.
Sri Lanka may seek 100,000 tonnes of optional origin wheat for delivery in January and February, they said.
Potential suppliers could include the United States, Argentina, Australian and Canada, they said.
Traders however stressed there was still no official word that a tender was in the pipeline.
"There is nothing official. We do not have a date for the tender," one trader said.
Another exporter said Sri lanka was expected to tender for the wheat in early January.
On November 27, Sri Lanka bought 100,000 tonnes of wheat from Australia and Argentina.
The deal included 50,000 tonnes of Australian soft white wheat wheat at $169.25 per tonne, including cost and freight, for December delivery.
Sri Lanka also purchased 50,000 tonnes of Argentine hard wheat at about $162-$163.93 per tonne for mid-January delivery
